metadata.title: Title: Presumed COVID-19 Index Case on Diamond Princess cruise ship and Evacuees to Hong Kong Running Title: First COVID-19 passenger in a cruise ship outbreak

body_text.text: diagnosis of COVID-19, the patient was transferred to the Hospital Authority Infectious Disease Centre (HAIDC) in Princess Margaret Hospital for further management. Lopinavir 400 mg/ritonavir 100 mg twice per day and ribavirin 400 mg twice per day were then started after obtaining consent from the patient. On January 18, 2020, he was discharged from HAIDC after 20 days of hospital stay.

Although our patient is the first passenger of the affected vessel diagnosed to have COVID-19, the origin of the outbreak in the cruise ship remains elusive. Instead of being the index patient of the outbreak, it is possible that our patient acquired the infection during the cruise trip. In fact, another patient was reported to have symptom onset before our patient. 2 Moreover, the source patient may even be asymptomatic and thus difficult to be identified as transmission from asymptomatic carriers has been reported. 3 Further epidemiological studies are necessary to unveil the dynamic of COVID-19 transmission in the cruise ship so as to prevent such a super-spreading event from happening again in the future.
After the confirmation of COVID-19 in our patient, the Japanese Ministry of Health, Labour, and

Welfare decided to quarantine the cruise ship carrying 2,666 passengers and 1,045 crew members off the coast of Yokohama. Subsequently, more than 600 patients related to the cruise ship were tested positive for SARS-CoV-2, among which more than 50% were asymptomatic and most had no close contact with infected patients. 4

BIBREF0.title: COVID-19 outbreak on the Diamond Princess cruise ship: estimating the epidemic potential and effectiveness of public health countermeasures

BIBREF2.title: Initial Investigation of Transmission of COVID-19

BIBREF3.title: Among Crew Members During Quarantine of a Cruise Ship -Yokohama

BIBREF5.title: Transmission of 2019-nCoV Infection from an Asymptomatic Contact in Germany

FIGREF0.text: Legend. Timeline illustrating the chronological sequence of (A) the patient's travel history and clinical course and (B) the quarantine of the cruise ship and the diagnosis of COVID-19 among the Hong Kong evacuees after returning to Hong Kong. COVID-19, coronavirus disease 2019; HAIDC, Hospital Authority Infectious Disease Centre; SARS-CoV-2, severe acute respiratory coronavirus 2.

TABREF0.text: ,5 After quarantine for 14 days in the cruise ship, the Hong Kong government arranged three chartered flights to evacuate 193 Hong Kong passengers who had no contact with the infected patients and tested negative for SARS-CoV-2. All the evacuees were quarantined in a designated quarantine camp for an additional 14 days upon arrival in Hong Kong. among the passengers on the Cruise ship (by close contact status, as of 02/19/2020). https://www.mhlw.go.jp/content/10200000/Fig2.pdf (accessed March 13, 2020).
